Nexus 10 is infamous for light bleed issues but this one is actually worse, much worse. Usually I could live with minor light bleeds since LCDs rarely come with absolutely free of light bleed. But the one I received has light bleeds so terrible that is beyond my tolerance. I am going to exchange it and see if the next one any better.

Reviews.Title: Not quite there
Reviews.Author: S. Curcio "Gator Bay Outdoors"
Reviews.Content: I have had this tablet for about a week and trying to decide if I want to keep it. There are nice things about it and not so nice, too. The screen is very bright and sharp. The color saturation is right on. The sound is loud enough to enjoy a movie, but will get lost in a busy environment.As for the negatives, I would have to start with the web browsing, because that's what these tablets are used for mostly. Pages tend to render in packets. The text will come up first, then the pictures. But, don't be too fast to click on anything just yet. The pages have to then arrange the contents, which takes longer than I experienced on an iPad or Windows tablet. Pictures and text slide around on the screen until everything is situated. Maybe the browsers cannot handle the floating content well. Who knows?As for the power, I have notice that it drops pretty fast from 100% to 30%. It's quicker than an iPad. Let's put it this way, after an evening of using it starting fully charged, I make sure to plug the tablet in before going to sleep. If I don't, it will not have much power left to use the next day. I suppose I am a bit spoiled after using an iPad, which had enough power to see me through two days of heavy usage. Still, I should be getting longer use out of this tablet per charge.The writing functions work nice. The pen produces very sharp lines as it glides smoothly across the display. However, the handwriting recognition is not working. I read that it is a problem Samsung will address shortly.Overall, I am still disappointed with many of the apps that are supposedly made for tablets. Although Google has pushed developers to produce apps specifically for larger screens, many of the apps look as though they are nothing more than stretched-out versions of the smartphone variety. I know there are diehard Android fans out there, but most of them are phone users, therefore they cannot see what I am talking about. In my eyes, even the Windows 8 tablet apps are better formatted for larger screens. Of course, I need not mention the iPad apps. Those are the best.So, I am deliberating whether to keep the Note 10.1 or not. There are too many quarks for me to use the tablet and be satisfied while doing so. I gave it a try because it is supposedly the best Android tablet being sold right now. So much for that. I tried.10/16/2013: Here is another annoyance I found. Samsung placed a couple of capacitive touch buttons in an awkward area on the bezel. One of those buttons is the back button, which is very sensitive. And, since the bezel is smaller with this model, it is more likely that you will touch that button and be taken away from the screen you are currently viewing. I had this happen to me quite often.

Reviews.Title: Took much longer to ship, I was very dissapointed in the speed of shipping
Reviews.Author: C. Baird "Dyson Lover Now"
Reviews.Content: This purchase was over $600 and I was dissapointed on how long it took to ship. I did complain to Amazon and received order many days after it was expected to arrive. After 2 days of using the tablet it had to be restored to factory setting, technician from Samsung recommended to return if it had any more issues. This is why I waited a month to send in the reveiw to ensure no more issues with this tablet. Otherwise it is a great investment

Reviews.Title: It wa not clear that this is wi-fi only
Reviews.Author: Parahat
Reviews.Content: It wa not clear that this is wi-fi only. Before items clearly identified as wi-fi only or 3G/LTE. There is minor lag compare to ipad.

Reviews.Title: Gets hot and battery drains twice as fast as my IPad Air
Reviews.Author: Bob Jones
Reviews.Content: I bought this Samsung tablet after having tons of fun with it at the popup Samsung Experience store.  The staff there were so in love with their Samsung products that I decided to give it a try.  Unfortunately it doesn't compare well to my IPad Air.  The Samsung's battery will drain twice as quickly and will get noticeably hot.  It's also heavier than the Ipad and is less intuitive for me and my son and two toddler nieces.  Other than those main pet peeves, the experience is very similar to the IPad.  But, I value the things I mention above quite a lot so likely won't buy another Samsung until they fix the above.

Reviews.Title: Not the snappy device I imagined
Reviews.Author: R Rated "Keeping it real"
Reviews.Content: Quite frankly, my Galaxy Note II phone is faster, more responsive and easier to use.  I opted to go with the Note 10.1, 2014 device over the other offerings from Apple and Kindle because of my familiarity of Android and the Note.  This tablet is heavier than it should be, slower than it's advertised and the screen display isn't eye popping off the screen it's purported to be, at least through my 20/20 vision and experience.  In short, it's clunky.The S Pen features are okay but hardly user friendly.  Saving a picture through a screen save is easy enough, but then writing on the picture with the S Pen?  NOT the same as the Galaxy Note II so ease of use on the tablet is, for me, not the same and not user friendly.  It seems to me that this tablet was created by a committee with every voice getting their oar in the water for the finished product which is a bit of a mess.

Reviews.Title: Mediocre at best
Reviews.Author: Jay H
Reviews.Content: I purchased this unit with great expectations. Unfortunately, I found this tablet to be slow and clunky even after the updates. I figured this had enough power and speed to bypass apps like amazon or ebay but forget it, by the time you click on a link, the page shifts and you find you clicked on something else that loaded lastly. Very annoying and very disappointing.I also own the note 8 and i feel the display and readability are both the same. I do not see a higher quality screen as compared to the note 8. I will keep my note 8 but I am sending the note 10 back to amazon. This is bulky, clunky and slow as compared to my note 8. It doesn't make sense to me but that's my finding.I thought this would be great for school, but nope, ill stick with my 3 year old sony vaio laptop which is much faster and versatile. If you think this will help you as a student, I would suggest pen and paper instead. By no means will this replace paper as some suggested. If they can adapt to this slow overpriced monstrosity, then all the power to them.My note 8 I purchased for use in school and perhaps substitute paper and pen with but that's not the case either. I pretty much use it to reference material that on lecture or just entertainment since its so small. I've then left it home since its pretty useless in school as well.Anyway, if you are a student considering to replace pen and paper, this is definitely something that WILL NOT perform that task. Stick with a nice small laptop and you will be just fine.Now if you just want to goof around and have time for this thing to load and browse with at home or something, that's just fine but i would spend the money on some other popular brand and leave this one on the shelf. This refresh is not worth the upgrade... So back it goes to the store....

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Tablet
Reviews.Author: Michael J Arnold
Reviews.Content: Our daughter will love his great tablet as a Christmas gift (I know I do after just setting it up for her).

Reviews.Title: An unbiased review that gives an honest  assessment
Reviews.Author: trt740
Reviews.Content: I bought tablet  a few days after release. It has super hardware specs and a beautiful screen; however, it seemed to me Samsung rushed its release in order to beat several other tablet coming to market. This Spen is great, yet the Note program needs to be refined to include a few more enhancement similar to the IOS program Notability. There are several bugs that Samsung should have addressed prior to release, and I am sure they will fix with future updates. The bezel appears to be cheap plastic, but I did like the leather back cover. The Polaris Office program is very good but lacks documentation. I returned both of the Notes I tried. One came slightly damaged and both had several software related issues. This does not mean this is a bad product but it is far from polished. I love Samsung and have owned several of their products including a two Samsung Galaxy phones and a Samsung Galaxy 5.0 Player. Their are several positives here, but as it stands now,  this is not a iPad replacement. It is not nearly polished enough and its battery life is not nearly as strong. For $600.00, it should be a lot more refined. I buy the best product from whoever makes it, and I have zero allegiance to any brand. My agenda is about work and productivity, and this product gets it done with several fixable bumps in the road.

Reviews.Title: Worst product ever!!
Reviews.Author: Kate
Reviews.Content: I just got this for a Christmas present to use at college because it was one of the few tablets that could have duel screens open and work with PDF files. I liked the fact that you could also use it for note taking.I am letting you know now if you are going to buy this for anyone in college or business DON'T!!!!!! It is really a piece of crap to put it nicely. I just started my first week of school last week and it worked like a dream. I was in love with it and took notes with it in all 4 of my classes and even purchased my textbooks on the tablet.To give you some information on how I treat this tablet, basically I treat it like gold. It is my most prize possession. The second I purchased it I also purchased the case for it and screen protector. In other words the tablet never dropped on the ground or got mistreated in any way.Now to carry on this horror story. So then just today after a week of using it I was in the middle of reading my class notes when it suddenly turned off and then promptly began turning on and off every 3-4 seconds. Nothing I did worked, and when I called samsung they told me how to do a hard reset. I tried that and it did not work at all. I was then informed that I would have to send it in LOSE ALL MY 16 PAGES OF NOTES FROM MY CLASS, and have to wait for them to fix it.My question is why the heck is something that is brand new so poorly made that after a week of use at college it messes up. I was either sold a lemon or it is really a piece of crap. Either way do your research online and see that I am one of many with this same problem. And the samsung people are not helpful at all the one I talked to had to put me on hold for 15 mins because she didn't know what to do with my problem. Do yourself a favor get a Surface, IPad or anything else that is not a samsung galexy tablet and save yourself from losing your work like me!!!!

Reviews.Title: Had to send  it back.
Reviews.Author: Harold Coates "Carguy"
Reviews.Content: I have another Note 10.1 that is one year old and it works fine. This one was for my wife, who has an older Ipad. This Samsung would get so hot after it was turned on for a while that she could not hold it. We decided to return it and got her a current model Ipad.

Reviews.Title: Smart Stay nor any of the smart or motion function works.
Reviews.Author: Leon Cassion
Reviews.Content: 1/7/2014:I am actually trying to find a fix with Samsung.After hours of "pain",  the File manager is gone.And maybe I will return the device.There is definitely something wrong.1/8/2014:**** Still I have problem with the smart stay. BUT for the other aspects, people in the support chat of Samsung do not know the device enough. I found this website that allows me to fix most of the problems: [...]The File manager is the Samsung folder and in the tray.

Reviews.Title: I knew this would happen
Reviews.Author: James Bayman
Reviews.Content: I waited for days and days for Amazon to have the Samsung 12.2 note Pro in Black. It listed as something was messed up, so I bought a refurbished 10.1 32 GB 2014 last night, and today, Amazon now has the option to sell the Black 12.2 --64 GB to it's customers, and this is the one I really wanted to buy, and I was comfortable with buying from Amazon...well that's how my luck is..so I am waiting for my 10.1 to come, and who knows, I might find a buyer in the future for my 10.1 and purchase the one I really want...:-(

Reviews.Title: Battery Hog.
Reviews.Author: L. Grinnell
Reviews.Content: I have the Note-3 and this tablet. I bought this tablet to play games on and they hang too often.The micro usb is nice for videos. Unfortunately, they drain my battery about a percent every 2 minutes. This is at 3/4 brightness using "Act 1 Video Player."If I use the charger while watching videos it still will drain the battery.I noticed after putting the tablet to sleep it will reload all the pre-packaged apps on wake-up. I messed up and drop-box automatically uploaded my music videos i transferred on my micro-usb from my laptop, wasting band-width.I own 3 ipads and I am not a Mac fan. I figured I would give this one a try and am sorely disappointed.Maybe in 6 months or so they can patch this out. Until then, save your money.I love the Note-3 by the way.

Reviews.Title: Great but to pricey!
Reviews.Author: Daniel Charlson
Reviews.Content: Nice but vary expensive. Don't know if I would buy another one only because of the price and i am not a penny pinche. I have a new Apple, Google nexus 7 and a Dell. The Dell is junk, all the others are vary good tablets.  I bought the Samsung tablet so it would match up with my Samsung s4 phone and my 2 Samsung T'S but the cost of this tablet makes it not worth it.

Reviews.Title: Went South
Reviews.Author: J. Anderson
Reviews.Content: I really liked this  tablet until it started locking up every 15 minutes.  Returned it.  Ordered another refurbished unit from another seller and so far tablet performs superbly.  Better that iPad, which I also own, due to stylus ability.  However,  I would not have paid list price. Refurbish was done by Samsung and was $150 cheaper than the $499 which some charge for new one.  Can't even tell it is refurbished.

Reviews.Title: Nice, but recording screen does not record sound ...
Reviews.Author: lzoto
Reviews.Content: Ultimately, by the time you are done with taxes and a service contract for only 1 year, you can up the price by $150 and more if you want a longer contract.  Then you need a screen protector ($35), a case ($35), and I wanted a carry bag ($30).  Ultimately, I spent $900.I do regret the amount invested in this tablet.  At the very least, the smaller sized tablet was far less money and would have been easier to carry around and I wasn't losing anything that mattered.I thought the Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 would allow me to record lectures as a video with sound, that is not the case.  You can make a video of your writing, but it has no sound.  You can make a voice recording, but the notes are then stationary.  For me, without that ability, this is a very expensive organizer with Internet access.  I knew I could do both but did not know you couldn't do them together.In addition, Flash is no longer supported for Android products - so no Flash.I do love watching videos on it.  For that, the screen resolution is a definite plus.The S Pen works well - which is what I would expect from Wacom.  The writing tools on the tablet are beneath what I am used to and can be time consuming to use.

Reviews.Title: ***IMPORTANT***  a little issue that seems to occur to others.
Reviews.Author: Sergey
Reviews.Content: I had to exchange this Note tab because the charger socket had issues.Amazon sent me a new Galaxy tab the next day I emailed them about the issue, so WONDERFUL service here...I would plug the cord in to charge but it would't stay solid.It wiggled and was sometimes charging, sometimes not.Very frustrating, even if a small thing.You would expect a similar priced tab to work seamlessly.From what I read on the net, this is mostly due TO THE POWER CORD AND NOT THE TAB ITSELF.So easily fixable.Other then that:PROS:--huge processing power, very fast, great multitasking.--amazing display resolution, you can actually see the difference.--very intuitive interface, easy navigation even for beginners.--the "stylus" is definitively a big plus. Allows for hand writing, precise manoeuvring and picture editing, among others.--Android operating system allows for FAR greater flexibility and control then iPad's OS.Cons:--the battery life could be better. If compared to iPad, at least 30% less.Hope I could help someone, tnx

Reviews.Title: A good tablet, but needs kit kat and work
Reviews.Author: Dylan
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to say too much about this tablet. I love android and I really enjoyed the nexus 10. There is some lag here and there, but nothing to really fuzz about. I made a decision by taking this one over the iPad air/mini, I choose the galaxy note 10.1. Why? S pen, android, productivity, freedom. These are things I enjoy and I'm not saying this is the tab for everyone. Really know what you're buying before getting disappointed

Reviews.Title: Amazon Warehouse Deals - "cosmetic" flaw is misleading, overall functionality is severely compromised
Reviews.Author: LAITH N YOUSIF
Reviews.Content: This review is NOT on the samsung galaxy note, but on the Amazon Warehouse Deal that I purchased it from. The description stated that there was a 1/4" by 1/4" "cosmetic" flaw on the front of the device. The description also mentioned that there was no original packaging or user manual. For these reasons alone, the description stated that it was selling the device for approx a 25% discount. There was no mention of any issues with functionality. When I received the tablet, I inspected it to identify where the cosmetic flaw was on the front of the device but could not find it. When I began to use the tablet, I began to notice that the functionality was severely compromised in a variety of ways.Text, buttons and other functional elements were frozen or missing from virtually every application. For example, it was impossible to browse the internet from any browser, it was constantly freezing or rapidly refreshing and chunks of the page would black out. Text would disappear from buttons or windows making it impossible to read and click/tap as needed. In some cases, the functional elements would go missing altogether. This happened whether in a browser or any application I launched. It even happened in the settings menu! The display also began to erode very quickly. Within just one day of use, or trying to use the tablet, white lines began to appear even when resting on the home screen.I understand that I received the item for a 25% discount, but I still paid close to $400 and would expect that the device would be somewhat functional. Given that the seller was Amazon itself, I trusted that the description was accurate. When I called to see what could be done, they offered an apology, a return but no replacement. It was very unfortunate to learn that they thought they could dump a non functional device on a very loyal long term amazon customer and then not even offer a replacement at the same offering price.

Reviews.Title: Good case with a few issues
Reviews.Author: Erol
Reviews.Content: This is a well made case. I was impressed with the material quality and professional look.However I had to return it because the automatic off feature gets activated when the cover is flipped back for normal use. So you open the tablet, unlock, and just when you are about to type the lid hits the back and turns the display off. Pretty annoying.Also the metal tab at the edge  hits the screen and scratch it.I switched to the Poetic case that looks similar and it is great, solves both of the above issues.

Reviews.Title: hard to view video
Reviews.Author: Steve Hall
Reviews.Content: Cannot play video from most websites without flash. Very frustrating . Have not found a good browser that works well

Reviews.Title: came without original box.
Reviews.Author: Ivica
Reviews.Content: It came without original box. There weren't included parts for pen. Disappointed. Previously I had Z1 tab and I think it is better choice.

Reviews.Title: chrges slowly, hate play store, insensitive touch
Reviews.Author: Shopmomsmart
Reviews.Content: It takes 30 hours for a full charge. Can onlyplay on it for a few hours before dies. The touch screen missesmost of my touches. Play store doesnt have a lot of my apps the I store has. Amazon prime does not work on this. I have to rebuy all my apps I had on I store. Clunky and awkward to use. I paid almost asmuch for this as my ipad. I also tried their phablet samsung galaxy note phone in March of 2014: same issues. Stay far away!!!

Reviews.Title: Well made but did not meet expectations
Reviews.Author: Robert Philo
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a device to "replace" a Windows computer which my wife uses to get email and to play on-line games. I thought this tablet would work for her but it did not for several reasons.  First, some of the games she likes to play require Java to run and you cannot load Java on this tablet.  Second, it was difficult for her to use the touch screen as opposed to the mouse she uses with the computer.  Finally, the email program she uses would not load on the tablet.  All of these issues may be true for any tablet but I had been told that this one would load Java and "most" other programs.

Reviews.Title: Poor design killed a great product
Reviews.Author: Just Some Guy "Just Some Guy"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: This is a general reply to the generally moronic comments from rabid Samsung fans, and I'm guessing a few people that live in their mothers basement at the age of 30. In case someone reads those comments considers taking them seriously, a few points:1) Yes, I'm reviewing the 2014 model. Please note "Amazon verified purchase" under my name.2) Yes, the relative lack of useability of the pen pushes this to a 2-star rating, which according to Amazon means "I don't like it". 3 stars means "I like it". Considering the one feature that sets this tablet apart and makes it one of (or the) most expensive Android tablet, is a design failure large enough to cause me to return it, I think I can say I DON'T LIKE IT.3)Of course turning the tablet upside down solves the problem of your palm accidentally hitting the home button. And if you use the device without a case and write with the device resting flat on a table or in your lap, you are good to go. However, I (like most people I would think) use it with a case. That is the only easy way to get the device resting on a flat surface at a 25 degree (or whatever) angle that makes it comfortable for writing. Have you seen the cases that can fold back at that angle? They all have cutouts for the different buttons (volume, power, s-pen, etc.) that only allow you to insert the device into the case one way, which is NOT upside down. So, you cannot use the upside down method if you are using a case.3-a)Even if a solution to the problem listed above (accidental home-button-pushing) is somehow found, it still doesn't solve the problem of that little ruler thing that runs along the bottom of the handwriting keyboard now.4)My problems weren't because I was using S-Note, because I don't use S-note. I was trying to write notes in Evernote. The app being used doesn't matter because it is the SAME handwriting keyboard that comes up for all apps. Really, what a nitwit comment.Yeesh, some the people ripping me a new one for my review don't even know what they are talking about. All I can say to someone reading this review and weighing whether or not buy the Note 10.1 is to go try it if you can somewhere - especially if you are buying it for the hand-writing capabilities with the s-pen.ORIGINAL REVIEW:I purchased the Galaxy Note 8 about 4 months ago and liked it a lot, but quickly realized it was too small. I used it to write take notes in Evernote for all of my meetings and it worked great for that. Connectivity with projectors was a problem, and the screen was too small to use remote desktop to get into my work server when I traveled. So when I heard about the Note 10.1 2014 coming out I planned to upgrade and pass the Note 8 on to one of my staff.Got the Note 10.1 a few days ago and it was like Christmas morning. Went through the standard setup where it downloaded not 1 but 2 updates to the Android operating system, downloaded all of my apps and got it set up just like my Note 8. Of course I wanted to play with it, so I opened up Evernote and started writing a fake note. I immediately realized there was a problem because the physical home button is in the middle of the tablet when you have it landscape mode, which is how I (and most users) would use it propped up at a slight angle (in its case) on a desk/table while in meetings. That home button ends up under your fist as you hand write your text across the screen, and about once every 3-5 times my hand touched the home screen I put enough pressure on the button to cause the Note to exit out of my program and go the home screen.Problem #2 is with the actual hand writing keyboard mode. It is different than the one that comes on the Note 8. It still looks like yellow note paper, but there is a weird little ruler running along the bottom. What happens on the Note 10.1 is that when you write, your hand writing moves to the left and eventually off the screen. You can touch that little ruler along the bottom and drag it to the right side of the screen to bring back previous text you wrote, I assume to be able to change it or something. The problem is that my hand would also catch that ruler and drag the text back towards the middle occasionally, which would cause whatever I am writing at that second to be over-written on a previous word, creating a mess with the text that actually ends up on the screen. It would also occasionally have a word jump over to the right side of the screen (I couldn't figure out why that was happening) and so what I was writing would get out of order.This is very difficult to explain so I'm sorry if I didn't do a good job. I tried recording a video of this but couldn't get my camera set up at a good angle. I suggest if you are considering buying this you call some local stores to see if any have them on display so you can try it. If you are like me and buying this tablet for the pen functionality then you really should try it.Oddly I didn't experience any of the lag that many of the professional reviewers (Engadget, Tech Radar, etc.) have complained about. Great looking and feeling device, and it was very responsive. But it is almost like they didn't do extensive user testing on this when they moved the home button and designed this new handwriting keyboard software. Very strange and disappointing.As an Android user since the first Droid phone came out (currently have a Galaxy S3 phone and still love it) this has been a real kick in the crotch. Since I have seen the benefit of having such a device with me at all times at work, and the benefit of being able to write naturally with a pen, it looks like I am going to have to go to a..a...oh this hurts, a Windows tablet. Have done a lot of research (and watched the youtube videos of handwriting keyboard!) and I'll be ordering the Lenovo Thinkpad Tablet 2.

Reviews.Title: A faulty product.
Reviews.Author: Dobees#1 "dobeelover"
Reviews.Content: After reading all the positive comments about this tablet here on amazon and having done my research on other sites, I decided to purchase one exactly a month ago at my local Best Buy with a 3 year protection plan. Now they have a 15 day period in which you can get a full refund or exchange if any problems occur. Exactly 1 day after that warranty expired, I started having multiple glitches on my tablet! It turned off abruptly several times while watching videos, playing games, surfing through the net, it wouldn't charge while I was using it, and the icing on the cake was that by the end of the month, for the last 2 days it failed to charge. I finally decided to take it back to the store to see if I could get a full refund or exchange, because after all its still new, only 1 month old, and with minimal use. I'm not one of those people who's glued to my tablet, cell phone, etc, so my world didn't come crashing down, but its still a huge inconvenience. Their rep, which btw was very courteous, tested it, and nothing happened, the tablet was dead. So, anyway, to make a long story short (too late), all Best Buy could do was send it to Geek Squad to have it fixed! I'll get it it back in approx. 2 weeks from today!! YAY!!I sure do hope either a Samsung Rep or Best Buy Manager read this post. I'm just dismayed at the faulty product I purchased from Samsung. It's still new, and its basically just a lemon. I can't believe that after just one month, my tablet had to be sent back for repairs. I'm just utterly amazed at the poor quality of certain products nowadays. Sadly, I've lost confidence in Samsung.So if you plan on purchasing this faulty product, take my comment into account.If you have any recommendations for myself or any other persons who've had this problem, please feel free to message me.My next step is to send a well written letter to Samsung.Oh well, as I like to say, when life throws you lemons, make some hard lemonade!I'll update whenever I get it back.Update!!OK so I finally got my tablet back............ 3 weeks later......Internal battery was changed, I apologize, I'm not a techie, but yes there were some hardware problems with the device, Geek squad took care of it. Best Buy rep admitted they've had several people come in with similar problems, though their tablets being much older. Got it home........would not charge, tested the USB cable on several outlets, and.......... nothing.Went back to Best Buy, purchased another cable, worked fine. So, Samsung, please include working cables with your products.......please?Been using it for about a couple of weeks since then, guess what? It still abruptly turns off, and it still does NOT charge while I'm using it...... ::sigh::But.......it's working.........most of the time. It's just an inconvenience when it turns off in an instant (even when it's fully charged), and you have to log back in and whatnot. Again, buyers beware.

Reviews.Title: very disappointing.
Reviews.Author: Vik Varma
Reviews.Content: horrible battery life, half-baked software, bulky, and heavy. The s-pen is a major letdown. I bought a Chromebook instead and i love it. ACER 720P to be exact! much more useful than a tablet.

Reviews.Title: Completely stopped working!
Reviews.Author: Max Bean
Reviews.Content: The Wi Fi completely stopped working. Now I basically have an expensive paperweight. I don't know how to reach anyone to figure out how to fix it.I bought it in November and it is passed the Return or Replace Policy. Would love some help from Amazon on this!!!One nice thing about brick and mortar is I could go in and talk to a person instead of hitting a dead end on the site.

Reviews.Title: Not for productivity
Reviews.Author: blahblah
Reviews.Content: The tablet is very good but it is still so limited by the operating  system. This is supposed to be a productivity tablet but it is really only good for surfing the Web and playing touch screen games.  If you are an artist it seems great for that too.  You can not mount a network drive and access to my printer/scanner is limited. Seriously how can you have a productivity tablet that can not mount a drive? All of my work files are on the network.  Using spreadsheets with the touch screen is painfull. If you are looking for productivity then by a laptop.

Reviews.Title: Nice product withdeceptive givaways
Reviews.Author: Victor Giarratano "Vic G"
Reviews.Content: Poor to no documantion and the $600 worth of applications is just a way to get your credit card number for deceptive sales practices.

Reviews.Title: ON STEROIDS, WITHOUT A PHONE!
Reviews.Author: David E. Braverman "debraver"
Reviews.Content: It does all it's advertised to do, but it's really little more than my Galaxy S4 on steroids, without a phone. Hard to do "real work" on it for extended periods of time. S4 smartphone is better investment, no need for a tablet.

Reviews.Title: Bigger Version Of Your Galaxy S4
Reviews.Author: Michael Mahern
Reviews.Content: It's basically a bigger verision of your Galaxy S4 nothing more nothing less so if you have the S4 and looking for something different don't buys this!!

Reviews.Title: i am not satisfy
Reviews.Author: Mindy Louis
Reviews.Content: well i ordered this samung galaxy on on the 18th february 2014 and today the 18 the of april its not coming on. i would like to know whats the problem.

Reviews.Title: NOT HAPPY WITH THIS SHOPPING
Reviews.Author: KATHIRESAN N
Reviews.Content: I bought this product to use it in India. I received this product to India using hopshopgo.com. They gave me US address for this transaction. After receiving this product I really shocked,  because this costly samsung product not working. I remitted Rs.7000 in India for customs duty.  After registered I brought it to samsung service centre. But they didn't accept it for doing service since this product is not introduced in India. I tried to return it to you . But your Web site is  also not taking return from India? If possible please help me.  THANKS.

Reviews.Title: There are no rugged, durable cases for this tablet.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love the tablet but would never buy it again because there is not a durable, rugged case for it. Otterbox makes great protective cases that are quite popular but not even Otterbox makes a case for this tablet. There are cases out there, but NONE of the cases provide any protection and are all just lipstick.So you buy a tablet which costs more than most laptops and Samsung doesn't even make a durable, rugged case to protect your investment??????

Reviews.Title: i hate it
Reviews.Author: davit
Reviews.Content: i hate itbecause after returning policy expired, next day the brightness controller stop working and i couldn't turn it on.so please help me fix it if you can.

Reviews.Title: Made of very cheap plastic that samasung did not bother to adhere it with good glue. Even the glue is cheap.
Reviews.Author: Shaer
Reviews.Content: The screen is nice.The software after disabling some application is responsive.But the main problem of the tablet is the cheap build quality: The speakers rattles, the screen occasionally makes sounds if pressed on the edges, the home button when pressed makes annoying cheap sound.Overall the Samsung cheap quality.The problem is that Samsung don't listen: so many reviews complained about the cheap quality of their products, like there phones and tablets, but they never listen.For a tablet around seven hundreds and rattles, this is unforgivable.There are many who will jump and defend the cheap plastic that this tablet is made of, claiming that it makes it less heavy. I don't think it's a good excuse.

Reviews.Title: Poor user interface response.
Reviews.Author: S. Balakrishnan
Reviews.Content: The user interface was slow. Tired all the tricks noted by others, but the responsiveness of android was 2 seconds or so slow.  Now switched back to iPad air.

Reviews.Title: Worst tablet bought ever.
Reviews.Author: Dustin St Jonn
Reviews.Content: Worst product and service I have ever gotten, from both Samsung and Amazon.I ordered a tablet, the thing arrived, and it wont turn on.  The screen doesnt display anything, but makes sound and noise when touched.  Amazon refused to exchange it, and are now telling me that I have to order a new one (which convienently went up in price since I ordered this one) and then pay to ship this back to them.Samsung is refusing to fix the product, giving me tons of work arounds such as "please plug it in to 4 different outlets to make sure it is charged all the way."Overall, stay away from the company, both of them.  Buy a tablet at a store which actually cares about its customers like Best Buy or any other place on the market.
